description:
If you try to use the new nova/tools/colorizer.py file with Python 2.6 you'll get:

./run_tests.sh 
Running `tools/with_venv.sh python setup.py testr --testr-args='--subunit  '`
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tools/colorizer.py", line 308, in <module>
    resultclass=NovaTestResult)
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'resultclass'
error: Broken pipe
title: python 2.6 doesn't support TextTestRunner resultclass

comments.content:
If you try to use the new nova/tools/colorizer.py file with Python 2.6 you'll get:

    resultclass=NovaTestResult)
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'resultclass'
error: Broken pipe

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/25174
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/25174
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/7a9ce26aaf03459a7ea367fbdb91d91626a1ee93
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 7a9ce26aaf03459a7ea367fbdb91d91626a1ee93
Author: Dan Prince <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Mar 22 15:12:35 2013 -0400

    py2.6 doesn't support TextTestRunner resultclass
    
    Updates tools/colorizer to account for the fact that Python
    2.6 doesn't support resultclass.
    
    This fixes issue in trying to use run_tests.sh on distributions
    which use python 2.6.
    
    Fixes LP Bug #1158940
    
    Change-Id: I763cd9c7a4b5ec5baaad3a3d9ee96e6e3cd13b3e
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
